result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Lee Poe

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Thomas Lee Poe in court, in custody.  Attorney Richard L. Voss Mr. in court for Thomas Lee Poe.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing. Defense recently received medical records and requests adjourned Plea hearing to allow additional time to review with Defendant.  Court finds good cause to adjourn this matter.  Defendant to be produced for next hearing. Case adjourned to Br. 9.   Plea hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order Approving Defendant's Attorney's Motion to Withdraw, signed and filed.

Defendant Thomas Lee Poe in court, in custody.  Attorney Richard L. Voss Mr. in court for Thomas Lee Poe.   Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea hearing.  Court is in receipt of Motion to Withdraw Counsel filed by Attorney Rasmussen. Attorney Rasmussen does not appear.  Defendant does not object to the withdrawal.  Motion GRANTED and order signed. Attorney Voss will remain as counsel for the Defendant having previously been appointed by the PD's office.  Defense advises of possible resolution and requests adjourned projected Guilty Plea hearing date be set.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Attorney's Motion to Withdraw as Counsel, filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 088649,
Payable Number: 1032705,
Receipt Number: 22RP037328,
Amount: $20.00

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court, defendant Thomas Lee Poe not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for pretrial conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests a plea hearing date be set. 
Case adjourned to Br. 9.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
DECLINATION REASON: The court withholds a decision on the State's motion filed on 7/18/22 to extend the discovery deadline. Judge Van Grunsven will address this motion at the next hearing on 8/12/22.
Motion for Modification of Discovery Exchange Schedule.  Received and Filed.  nk

Attorney Richard L. Voss in court, defendant Thomas Lee Poe not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Court sets deadline for discovery, with the exception of crime lab reports, and initial offer to be turned over to defense for 07/18/2022. Court sets 08/08/2022 for the deadline to file motions or change of plea forms. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Thomas Lee Poe in court, appear by video with attorney Richard L. Voss, appear by video.  Defendant Thomas Lee Poe in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer K.Kamps.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Thomas Lee Poe not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for preliminary hearing. State witness present.  SPD has not appoint counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  24 hour curfew with the exception of verified legal appointments.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $50,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No driving during pendency of case.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Thomas Lee Poe in court with attorney Thomas R. Reed.  Defendant Thomas Lee Poe in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thomas Lee Poe appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
